DOC.detailed_description: Background Women undergo external cephalic version ( ECV ) order turn baby breech ( bottom , foot ) presentation head position . The procedure traditionally 40 % success rate may painful , issue recent literature suggest put woman . Pain relief use short act morphine-like painkiller , call remifentanil , significantly reduce pain experienced seem improve ECV success rate . Alternatively , spinal anaesthetic ( similar use caesarean section ) use . This increase success rate around 60 % effectively reduce pain ; however , invasive procedure potential complication require hospital stay least half day . Aims objectives The investigator aim perform qualitative study explore view woman breech presentation management general , use anaesthesia analgesia ECV particular . Methods The investigator use semi-structured interview explore view 10-15 expectant mother recruit Breech Clinic Chelsea Westminster Hospital . Interviews record transcribe thematic analysis two researcher . Dissemination output To knowledge , first report woman view use regional anaesthesia remifentanil analgesia ECV . In addition , add view patient population exist literature concern management ECV general . The investigator anticipate information use plan service guide future research .
